conversation.message: Dear School_B admissions team, I’m Student_B and School_B is my first-choice school. I’m very motivated to join and would accept an offer immediately if admitted. Thank you for considering my application.
conversation.thought: My top choice is School_B, but I am only 3rd in School_B’s priority list (behind Student_D and Student_A). Both Student_D and Student_A have higher-ranked alternatives they may pursue first (D’s top is School_C; A’s top is School_A). In round 1, the best move to maximize my outcome is to apply immediately to my true first choice to try to secure it before higher-priority students turn to it later.

conversation.message: Dear Student_B, thank you for your application and for sharing that School_B is your first choice. After reviewing our priorities for this cycle, we’re not able to offer you admission at this time. We appreciate your interest and wish you the best in the matching process.
conversation.thought: Student_B is 3rd on School_B’s true priority list (behind Student_D and Student_A). With quota 1, accepting now would lock us out of potentially matching with Student_D or Student_A if they apply later. Given we have full information: Student_D ranks School_B 3rd (after School_C and School_A) and Student_A ranks School_B 4th, so they may not apply immediately, but they are still feasible later. Since we can’t delay an [APPLY] with [TALK], the best strategy to maximize our outcome is to reject Student_B now and keep capacity for higher-priority candidates.

conversation.message: Hello School_C admissions committee. I’m Student_D, and School_C is my first-choice school. I’m applying because I strongly want to enroll if admitted. I’m especially excited about joining a rigorous academic environment and contributing actively to school life. Thank you for considering my application.
conversation.thought: My top choice is School_C. I have relatively strong priority there (3rd, behind Student_C and Student_B). To maximize my chance at my true first choice, I should apply immediately and clearly signal strong commitment so School_C will hold my seat unless a higher-priority applicant applies.

conversation.message: Dear Student_D, thank you for your application and for sharing your strong interest in School_C. We appreciate your enthusiasm for our rigorous academics and school community. We are pleased to offer you admission to School_C. [ACCEPT]
conversation.thought: As School_C, my true priority list ranks Student_D 3rd (behind Student_C and Student_B). I currently have one applicant: Student_D, who also ranks School_C as first choice, meaning accepting would likely lock in a stable match. However, in a student-proposing environment, Student_C (my top choice) prefers School_D first and may not apply to me unless rejected elsewhere; Student_B ranks School_C last and is unlikely to apply. Given uncertainty about receiving higher-ranked applicants and the benefit of securing a committed student now within quota 1, accepting Student_D is a strong move rather than risking ending unmatched or with a lower-priority student later.

conversation.message: Dear School_D admissions team, I’m Student_E. School_D is one of my top choices, and I’m applying because I believe I would be a strong and committed fit for your school community. If admitted, I will accept and enroll. Thank you for your consideration.
conversation.thought: My top choice is School_C, but School_C ranks me 4th (behind Student_C, Student_B, Student_D). With capacity 1, I’m unlikely to win there if those students apply. School_B is my 2nd choice and ranks me 5th, also tough. School_D is my 4th choice but ranks me 2nd (behind only Student_D), giving me a strong acceptance chance in round 1. To maximize the probability of matching to a relatively high option on my true list, I should apply to School_D immediately before it fills with Student_D.

conversation.message: Dear Student_E, thank you for your application and for your commitment to enroll if admitted. We are pleased to offer you admission to School_D. We look forward to welcoming you to our community. [ACCEPT]
conversation.thought: As School_D, my true priority is D > E > C > B > A, with quota 1. This round I have [APPLY] from Student_E and Student_C. Student_E is ranked higher than Student_C on my list, so accepting E now secures a better-ranked student than waiting for C. Student_D (my top choice) has School_D as last choice, so is very unlikely to apply later; holding out risks ending with a lower-ranked student or no match. Student_E also states they will enroll if admitted, reducing uncertainty. Therefore, accept Student_E.

conversation.message: Hello School_D admissions team—I'm Student_C. School_D is my first choice, and I’m applying because your program is the best fit for my goals. If accepted, I will commit to enrolling. Thank you for your consideration.
conversation.thought: My top choice is School_D, but School_D’s priority list ranks me 3rd (behind Student_D and Student_E). Student_D also ranks School_D last, so they likely won’t apply there. Student_E ranks School_D 4th, so they may apply elsewhere first. This gives me a realistic chance to secure my #1 if I apply immediately and signal strong commitment.

conversation.message: Dear Student_C, thank you for your application and for sharing that School_D is your first choice. At this time, our available seat has already been filled, so we’re unable to offer you admission in this round. We appreciate your interest in School_D and wish you the very best in the process.
conversation.thought: Our quota is already filled (Remaining Quota: 0) with Student_E from this round’s acceptance. Per rules, with quota 0 we must reject any new [APPLY] regardless of priority. Student_C is ranked above Student_E on our true priority list, but we cannot undo an established match within this protocol, so we must reject Student_C’s application now.

conversation.message: Hello School_A admissions committee—I'm Student_A and School_A is my first-choice school. I’m very excited about the opportunity to join and would enroll if admitted. Thank you for considering my application.
conversation.thought: My top choice is School_A, so I should apply immediately. Although School_A ranks me 3rd (behind Student_B and Student_D), applying now gives me the best chance to secure my first choice before higher-priority students potentially take the single seat. I will express strong commitment to increase the likelihood they hold the seat for me if possible.

conversation.message: Dear Student_A, thank you for your application and for your strong interest in School_A. After reviewing our priorities and the limited availability this cycle, we’re not able to offer you admission at this time. We appreciate your time and wish you the very best in the process.
conversation.thought: Student_A is 3rd on School_A’s true priority list (behind Student_B and Student_D). Although Student_A ranks School_A first and would enroll, accepting now would fill our only seat and could block a higher-priority match if Student_B or Student_D apply in later rounds. Since we can only respond with ACCEPT/REJECT to an APPLY, the best strategy to maximize our priority outcome is to reject Student_A now and wait for higher-priority candidates.

conversation.message: Dear School_A Admissions Committee, I’m Student_C. After careful consideration, I’m formally applying to School_A because your academic environment and opportunities align strongly with what I’m looking for in high school. If admitted, I will commit to enrolling. Thank you for your time and consideration.
conversation.thought: School_D (my #1) already rejected due to its seat being filled, so I should move to my next-best available option. Among unmatched schools (A, B, E), School_A is my #2 true preference, so I will apply there. Although School_A ranks me last in its priority list, applying now is still my best chance to secure a high-ranked placement; if rejected, I can pivot to School_B next round. I will signal strong fit and commitment if accepted.

conversation.message: Dear Student_C, thank you for your application and for your interest in School_A. After reviewing our priorities and limited availability this cycle, we’re not able to offer you admission at this time. We appreciate your time and wish you the best in the remainder of the process.
conversation.thought: School_A has 1 seat and full information. Our true priority is B > D > A > E > C. In this round we have applications from Student_B and Student_C. Student_B is our top priority and has stated they will accept immediately, so we should preserve the seat for B. Accepting C now would block a better match. Therefore reject Student_C.

conversation.message: Dear School_A admissions team, I’m Student_B. School_A is one of my top choices, and I’m very excited about the opportunity to join your community. If admitted, I will accept the offer immediately and withdraw from other conversations. Thank you for your consideration.
conversation.thought: School_B (my top choice) already rejected me, so I move to my next-best available option. School_A is 3rd on my true list and, importantly, School_A’s priority ranks me #1 overall, giving me an excellent chance to secure a match immediately. I will apply directly and credibly commit to accept if offered.

conversation.message:
Dear Student_B,

Thank you for your application and for your strong interest in School_A. We are pleased to offer you admission. Your stated commitment to enroll is appreciated, and we look forward to welcoming you to our community.

Sincerely,
School_A Admissions
conversation.thought: Student_B is #1 on School_A’s true priority list and has submitted an [APPLY] with a commitment to enroll if admitted. We have quota 1 remaining and no existing matches. Although Student_C also applied this round, Student_C is last on our priority list and has already been rejected previously. Accepting Student_B immediately secures our top-choice match and is optimal given the market and our capacity constraint.

conversation.message:
Dear School_B Admissions Committee,

I’m Student_A and I’d like to formally apply to School_B. After learning more about the school, I believe I’d be a strong fit for your community and would be excited to enroll if offered a place. Thank you for considering my application, and I appreciate your time in reviewing candidates for this cycle.

Sincerely,
Student_A
conversation.thought: School_A already rejected me and has higher-priority candidates (Student_B, Student_D) likely to apply, so reapplying is unlikely to succeed. Among remaining unmatched schools, School_B is my 4th choice but I have relatively strong priority there (2nd, behind Student_D). School_E is my last choice (though I’m top priority there), so I should try for School_B first to maximize my outcome while still being realistic. I will submit a clear, sincere application and signal strong interest to improve acceptance chances if they are considering close candidates.

conversation.message:
Dear Student_A,

Thank you for your application and for your interest in School_B. After reviewing our priorities for this cycle, we are pleased to offer you admission to School_B. We would be excited to welcome you to our community.

Sincerely,
School_B Admissions Committee
conversation.thought: Student_A is #2 on School_B’s true priority list (behind only Student_D) and is currently applying. We already rejected Student_B (#3) to keep capacity for higher-priority candidates. Student_D (#1) has not contacted us yet and, per preferences, ranks School_B as 3rd (after School_C and School_A), so they may not apply here soon or at all. With quota 1, accepting Student_A now secures a high-priority match and avoids the risk of ending unmatched while waiting for Student_D. Therefore, accept Student_A.

conversation.message: Dear School_E Admissions Team, I’m Student_C. I understand seats are limited, and I’d like to formally apply to School_E. While I previously pursued other options, I genuinely value the opportunities and community at School_E, and if admitted I will commit to enrolling. Thank you for your consideration.
conversation.thought: Only School_E remains unmatched and it is on my true preference list (though lowest). Since I was rejected by my top choices and there may be only one seat left in the market, I should secure a match now by applying and credibly committing if accepted.

conversation.message:
Dear Student_C,

Thank you for your application and for your clear commitment to enroll if admitted. We are pleased to offer you admission to School_E. Please confirm that you will accept this seat and proceed with the enrollment steps as instructed.

Sincerely,
School_E Admissions
conversation.thought: Student_C is #2 on School_E’s true priority list (only Student_A is higher). We have quota 1 and only Student_C applied this round. Waiting for Student_A is risky because Student_A ranks School_E last, so they are unlikely to apply unless rejected everywhere else. Accepting Student_C secures a high-priority match immediately and is preferable to holding the seat open with uncertain prospects.
